room_name.title: Smart Climate Control Setup (Step 1 of 6)
room_name.description:
Welcome to the **2-Minute Smart Climate Control Setup!** üöÄ

**What makes this special:**
‚ú® Just answer 2 temperature questions - everything else is automatic!
‚ú® Blueprint calculates all 6 temperature tiers for you
‚ú® Stall detection, escalation, hysteresis - all configured optimally
‚ú® Works perfectly out of the box for 90% of users

**What will be created:**
‚Ä¢ 13 helper entities (automatic tracking)
‚Ä¢ Complete blueprint automation (fully configured)
‚Ä¢ Dashboard control card (optional)
‚Ä¢ Production-ready climate control system

**Let's get started!**

Enter the room name you want to control:

data.room_name: Room Name (e.g., Living Room, Bedroom, Office)

features.title: Select Features (Step 2 of 6)
features.description:
Choose which features to enable for **{room_name}**.

**All features are recommended for best performance!**

These determine which helper entities will be created and which automation features will be available.

data.enable_manual_override: ‚úÖ Manual Override Detection (detects manual AC changes)
data.enable_smart_mode: ‚úÖ Smart Mode (presence detection and timeout logic)

climate_entities.title: Select Climate Entities (Step 3 of 6)
climate_entities.description:
Select the A/C unit(s) for **{room_name}**.

You can select multiple A/C units if your room has more than one.

**Tip:** If you don't see your A/C, make sure it's properly integrated in Home Assistant first.

sensors.title: Select Sensors (Step 4 of 6)
sensors.description:
Configure optional sensors for **{room_name}**.

**All sensors are optional but recommended for best accuracy!**

**Temperature Sensor:** External thermometer for more accurate readings

**Room Presence Sensors:** Add your BLE sensors (e.g., sensor.phone_ble_area), motion sensors (PIR), mmWave sensors, or any occupancy detection sensors.

**üõèÔ∏è For Bedrooms:** Include bed occupancy sensors (e.g., binary_sensor.bed_occupancy) for sleep detection! You can select multiple sensors for better accuracy.

data.room_presence_sensors: Room Presence Sensors - BLE, Motion, mmWave, Bed Sensor, etc. (optional, multiple)

presence_detection.title: Home/Away Detection (Step 4.5 of 6)
presence_detection.description:
**Configure home/away presence detection for {room_name}.**

**Person Entities (Recommended):**
Select people to track for home/away detection and proximity-based pre-conditioning.

**Why add these even if you have room sensors?**
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Enables Auto mode as fallback option
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Allows switching between Smart and Auto modes
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Provides house-wide automation when needed

**Presence Devices (Optional):**
Additional devices that indicate someone is home (PC power, TV, gaming console, etc.)

**üéØ Smart Mode Selection:**
‚Ä¢ **With room sensors** ‚Üí Defaults to Smart mode (room-specific)
‚Ä¢ **Without room sensors** ‚Üí Defaults to Auto mode (house-wide)
‚Ä¢ **Both available** ‚Üí You can switch modes anytime!

data.presence_devices: Presence Devices - PC, TV, Workstation, etc. (optional)

proximity_detection.title: üè† Proximity Pre-Conditioning (Step 4.6 of 6)
proximity_detection.description:
**Start cooling/heating BEFORE you arrive home!**

**How it works:**
‚Ä¢ üöó Tracks your location via GPS (phone)
‚Ä¢ üéØ Detects when heading towards home
‚Ä¢ ‚ùÑÔ∏è Starts conditioning when within range
‚Ä¢ ‚ú® Room is comfortable when you arrive

**Setup Status:** {home_zone_status}

**Setup Requirements:**
1. **Home zone** (Settings ‚Üí Areas ‚Üí Zones ‚Üí Create "Home" zone)
2. **Proximity integration** (Settings ‚Üí Integrations ‚Üí Add ‚Üí Proximity)
   - Select "home" zone
   - Select person entities to track
3. **Phone GPS enabled** (Home Assistant Companion App)

**Don't have Proximity setup?**
Leave unchecked - you can enable this later by editing the blueprint manually.

**Already have Proximity?**
Check the box below and select your sensors!

data.proximity_sensor: üìè Distance Sensor ‚Ä¢ Shows how far you are from home ‚Ä¢ Usually sensor.home_nearest_distance
data.direction_sensor: üß≠ Direction Sensor ‚Ä¢ Shows if heading towards/away ‚Ä¢ Usually sensor.home_nearest_direction_of_travel
data.home_zone_distance:
üéØ Activation Distance (meters)
How far from home to start ‚Ä¢ 5000m = 5km

bedroom_mode.title: Bedroom Configuration (Step 5 of 6)
bedroom_mode.description:
Is **{room_name}** a bedroom with a bed occupancy sensor?

**üõèÔ∏è BEDROOM Mode Benefits:**
‚Ä¢ Detects presence when sleeping (bed sensor)
‚Ä¢ Detects presence when awake (motion sensor)
‚Ä¢ Prevents false positives (phone left behind)
‚Ä¢ Works with any sensor combination

**Select YES if:**
‚Ä¢ This is a bedroom
‚Ä¢ You added a bed occupancy sensor above
‚Ä¢ You want the AC to stay on while sleeping

**Select NO for:**
‚Ä¢ Living rooms, offices, other areas
‚Ä¢ Bedrooms without bed sensors

temperature.title: Temperature Preferences (Step 6 of 6)
temperature.description:
**Just 2 simple questions!** üå°Ô∏è The wizard automatically calculates ALL temperature thresholds for **{room_name}**.

**Choose your comfort style:**
‚Ä¢ **Tight** (¬±0.5¬∞C): Precise control, 20+ AC cycles/day
‚Ä¢ **Balanced** (¬±1.0¬∞C): ‚≠ê Recommended, 10-15 cycles/day
‚Ä¢ **Relaxed** (¬±1.5¬∞C): Energy saving, 5-10 cycles/day

**Example:** 23¬∞C ¬± 1.0¬∞C means:
‚Ä¢ Comfort zone: 22.0¬∞C - 24.0¬∞C (AC off)
‚Ä¢ Gentle cooling starts: 24.1¬∞C
‚Ä¢ Medium cooling starts: 25.0¬∞C
‚Ä¢ Max cooling starts: 26.0¬∞C
‚Ä¢ *(Heating thresholds calculated similarly)*

**What happens next:**
‚úÖ All 6 temperature tiers calculated automatically
‚úÖ Stall detection configured optimally
‚úÖ Dynamic escalation/de-escalation enabled
‚úÖ Ready to use immediately!

‚ö†Ô∏è Home zone is not configured in Home Assistant. Proximity-based pre-conditioning requires a 'Home' zone to work.

**To create the Home zone:**
1. Go to Settings ‚Üí Areas, labels & zones ‚Üí Zones
2. Click 'Add Zone'
3. Name it 'Home'
4. Set your home location on the map
5. Save and run this wizard again

**Or:** Uncheck the proximity option and continue without this feature.

init.title: Options
init.description:
**Note:** Changing these options will NOT automatically create or delete helpers or modify the automation.

To update your setup, you'll need to:
1. Manually create/delete helpers as needed
2. Update the automation configuration

This is mainly for tracking which features you enabled.
